sourceOfFunds.purpose: This program was implemented in 2 slum areas of Shahdol city. Health, Hygiene, Tree plantation, Cleanliness program, Malnutrition were major activities. One bamboo craft training was organized for bamboo artisans.

Women empowerment through self help group. Groups formed and nurtured and made credit worthy. Groups received revolving funds from NRLM. Livelihood planning is in progress. ST families are major beneficiaries.

Among 2 slum pockets of city skill development training was held for women beneficiaries. Training was of 10 days. Identification of children falling under mal-nutrition category were reported to concern department and corrective measures taken.

WSHGs WERE PROMOTED AND NURTURED FOR MAKING THEM CREDIT WORTHY. TRAINING PROGRAMS WERE CONDUCTED. SPECIAL CAPACITY BUILDING PROGRAMS CONDUCTED. VEGETABLE SEEDS WERE DISTRIBUTED AND FOOD PROCESSING TRAINING WAS ORGANIZED.
PROJECTED STARTED FOR PROMOTION OF FARMERS PRODUCER COMPANY. MOBILIZATION FOR MEMBERSHIP WAS CONDUCTED. PROJECT WILL RESULT INTO AN EMPOWERED COMPANY TO PERFORM THEIR OWN BUSINESS.

WSHGs PROMOTED BY THE ORGANIZATION WERE EMPOWERED THROUGH SPECIAL WOMEN LITERACY. VILLAGES LEVEL CENTERS WERE ESTABLISHED. RESOURCE TEACHERS WERE FROM THE VILLAGES. THIS MOVE CREATED GOOD ATMOSPHERE FOR WOMEN LITERACY.

ngoList.title: samagam rangmandal
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: samagam rangmandal is one of the leading theater group of jabalpur .we are active throughout the year,daily at 5 to 8p.m.at parsai bhavan,madan mahal,jabalpur,our reharsal place. samagam rangmandal is a group ofmorethan50professional,nonprofessional,actor,singer,writer,folk dancer and singer,director,craft and makeupman,lightman,costume specialist etc. samagam rangmandal s major activities are as follows: 1.RANG SAMAGAM- conducting 5 days national theater festival at jabalpur alongwith poetry recitation on famous poets like ram prasad bismil,faiz,kedarnath,shamsher,agayey,nagarjun,rabindranath taigore etc.. 2.RANG VINIMAY-conducting 2 days theater exchange programme alongwith diffrent theater groups of the country. 3.PRODUCTIONS: samagam rangmandal s famous productions are POPCORN,RED FROCK,SOMNATH,HAYWADAN,ASSI LAKH,VISHKANYA,THE DUMB DANCER,SUDAMA KE CHAWAL,SUGHANDHI,AGARBATTI,VIJAYNAGAR,PRATIUTTART,JATHARAGNI,CHAURAHA,EK AKELI AURAT ETC. 4.PERFORMANCES:performed above plays at diffrent places in m.p.,u.p.,bihar,w.bengal,rajasthan,gujrat,maharashtra,c.g.,punjab,hariyana in association with n.c.z.c.c.,s.c.z.c.c.,rajasthan sangeet natak akadmi,cultural deptt.raipur,ustad allauddin khan akadmi bhopal,swaraj sansthan bhopal and other gov. and non gov.cultural centers of india. 5.THEATER WORKSHOPS:conducting theater workshop for diffrent collegs ,university,cmm,dainik bhaskar jabalpur to enhance theater activities in jabalpur. 6.POETRY:making poetry poster and t shirts on renouned poets of india to spread intrest towords poetry in youth. working with a team of dedicated artist to promote theater 365 days in ayear.

To do monitoring of 250 water tankers distributed among 250 Gram Panchayats in Chhindwara district under Water Security Project of YES FOUNDATION. To do monitoring of 250 water tankers distributed among 250 Gram Panchayats in Chhindwara district under Water Security Project of YES FOUNDATION.

Skill development training program for poor marginalized women was run in Chhindwara district at village and district level by Satyakam Jan Kalyan Samiti, Chhindwara to link the poor rural women and girls of ST, SC, OBC and Muslim community. 120 poor and unemployed women and girls has trained under this program, so that they can have a source of income to fulfill their basic needs.

Internet Saathi programme is a digital initiative programme being implemented from July 2017 in Chhindwara district by Satyakam Jan Kalyan Samiti (SJKS) in partnership with Tata Trusts, Google India and Phia Foundation. This programme aims to address the gender disparity in internet use in rural India which puts women in rural India at further risk of getting marginalized in the society. It seeks to do so by empowering rural women and communities in digital literacy.

Satyakam Jan Kalyan Samiti has organized one month handmade bamboo stick making in Handicrafts and Carpet sector of Skill India training for PWD youth under the scheme for the disabled persons of the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment in association with Samathan Samajik Sansthan, Bhopal, so that disabled young men and women can develop their skills and get employment opportunities.

Satyakam Jan Kalyan Samiti (SJKS) has conducted family survey of 38140 house holds under 48 wards of Chhindawara Munciple Corporation with Laxmi Civil Engineering Service Pvt Ptd, MPUDC (Madhya Pradesh Urban Development Company) which was supported by World Bank from September to November 2017. The main objective of this project was to spread awareness among the community about cleanliness through sewerage pipelines and harmful empacts of open drain on health and environment.

SJKS has conducted activies of cleanliness drive under the fundamentals of ‘Madhya Pradesh Clean India Mission’ in association with Astha Cultural and Social Welfare Committee in 18 wards of Hoshangabad District with the consent and cooperation of the Municipality and Ward Councilors. ICE activities were organized in wards and Educational Institutes in the municipality area of Hoshangabad.

Skill development training program for poor marginalized women was run in Chhindwara district at village and district level by Satyakam Jan Kalyan Samiti, Chhindwara to link the poor rural women and girls of ST, SC, OBC and Muslim community. 120 poor and unemployed women and girls have trained under this program, so that they can have a source of income to fulfill their basic needs.

Internet Saathi programme is a digital initiative programme implemented in Chhindwara district by Satyakam Jan Kalyan Samiti (SJKS) in partnership with Tata Trusts, Google India and Phia Foundation. This programme aims to address the gender disparity in internet use in rural India which puts women in rural India at further risk of getting marginalized in the society. It seeks to do so by empowering rural women and communities in digital literacy.

Moving forward to the Internet Partner Program, we have started working on Digital Livelihood, under this initiative we have worked for Internet Trust and Safety with Phia Foundation and FREND. This was one-month program, in which 443 saathis from Chhindwara and Seoni District gave training to rural women and girls on online safety through smart phones provided under the project. Total 44300 rural women and girls were become aware of online safety.

Partners for equality Project is running by SJKS under EkSaath national Campaign with support and Guidance of CHSJ (Center for Health and Social Justice), New Delhi in Chhindwara district for Mentorship of Samanta Saathis of Ek Saath National Campaign to Involve Men and Boys as Partners in Changing Discriminatory Gender Social Norms.
